21197D83ED1B4A11A7DD29A9BC0F71AF.description: Solve unit rate problems including those involving unit pricing and constant speed. 3. Find a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100 (e.g., 30% of a quantity means 30/100 mes the quantity); solve problems involving finding the whole, given a part and the percent. 4. Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units.

6EFE47D8F5044BEAAEC12CA1629CCE36.description: Make tables of equivalent ratios relating quantities with whole-number measurements, find missing values in the tables, and plot the pairs of values on the coordinate plane. Use tables to compare ratios.

0AA539B2E660495D95477CE528326B16.description:
Understand
the concept of
a unit rate a/b
associated
with a ratio a:b
with b ≠ 0, and
use rate
language in the
context of a
ratio relationship.
